alert.note: Alert for Marin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 10:05AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southern Sonoma and northern Marin counties in northern California. * WHEN...Until noon PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1003 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain continuing to affect the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Sonoma, Sebastopol, Cotati, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Roseland, Tomales, Larkfield-Wikiup, Dillon Beach, Point Reyes Station, Boyes Hot Springs, Forestville, Guerneville, South Santa Rosa, Graton, Occidental and Glen Ellen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
